DOC.brief_summary: The aim pilot study determine feasibility Do-It-Yourself study pregnant woman detect change health parameter assess compliance user experience participant . Besides , measure health analysed increase insight physiological development pregnant woman .
DOC.brief_title: PregnanT Moms Measure - Do-It-Yourself Health Monitoring Simulation Health Pregnant Women
DOC.detailed_description: The study design open , parallel , do-it-yourself , explorative , two-group study . Subjects woman pregnant approximately 3 month start study . Subjects include week 12 15 pregnancy ( T=-1 ) . Week 16 start study ( T=0 ) . In first group obese pregnant woman ( BMI ≥ 30 ) include ; second group consist lean pregnant woman ( BMI 18,5 - 25 ) . The woman request assess physiological parameter regular interval three month pregnancy give birth ( week 40 ) . The assessment give birth , three month give birth ( total study duration approximately nine month ) , optional . Health parameter know subject change pregnant woman ; self-monitoring device able show change . Included subject provide do-it-yourself device , manual study protocol . During nine-month study , subject use do-it-yourself device self-monitor multiple health parameter at-home set . They remind perform test via SMS . There two frequency interval define ( two week interval eight week interval ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Pregnant 1215 week start study ; 2 . Healthy assess Health Lifestyle questionnaire ( P9624 F02 ) ; 3 . Body mass index : BMI 18,5 25 lean group BMI ≥ 30 obese group ; 4 . Able use selfmonitoring device ; 5 . Voluntary participation ; 6 . Having give write informed consent ; 7 . Willing comply study procedure ; 8 . Willingness share pseudonymised data measure health parameter external party provide measure device ( include MijnEetmeter , Moves NRC ) reason synchronisation study database ; 9 . Willing accept use nameless data , include publication , confidential use storage data TNO ; 10 . Have internet access home ; 11 . Subjects Smartphone Bluetooth run either recent version iOS Android . 1 . Use concomitant medication ; 2 . Having history medical surgical event may significantly affect study outcome , include physical limitation cardiovascular event ; 3 . Having ( history ) medical condition might significantly affect study outcome judge principal investigator health life style questionnaire . This include diabetes type 1 2 , gastrointestinal dysfunction , disease related inflammation , psychiatric disorder ; 4 . Hypertension : systolic blood pressure > 160 mmHg , diastolic blood pressure > 90 mmHg ; 5 . Having pacemaker ; 6 . Previous pregnancy medical issue ( e.g . preeclampsia ) ; 7 . Reported slimming medically prescribe diet ; 8 . Physical , mental practical limitation use computerized system ; 9 . Alcohol consumption > 14 unit ( drink ) /week ; 10 . Smoking ; 11 . Reported unexplained weight loss gain > 2 kg three month prior prestudy screen / pregnancy ; 12 . Recent blood donation ( < 1 month prior start study ) ; 13 . Not willing give blood donation study ; 14 . Personnel TNO partner .
